intro: Crotalaria toamasinae, commonly known as the Madagascar crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous annual, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets, and it produces elongated pods that contain several seeds. It is adapted to thrive in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed habitats.
